be taken lightly or used as an elective choice ve met number of women that regretted that choice deeply while they watched me pack the incision with gauze and hook the wound vac to wound that just would heal there was also the family that watched me do cpr on their infant hours after the elective section he was nursing and then just went blue making it all about sexism and misogyny completely disagree that moms bashing other moms has anything to do with sexism and it seems like the author is almost using the topic for her own agenda do think that our culture forces women to shut up and deal with birth they are happy with everything that ve ever seen has been supportive and focused on the well being of the mother and baby sure ve heard some stories here and there but the overwhelming majority is not bad at all myself am young low income mother and had an amazing pregnancy and birth experience every time ever read book looked something up online talked to friend or family member or nurse at my doctors office or random stranger at the grocery store everything and everyone have always been positive and supportive of me and my choices as the mother also have never heard someone call mother high maintenance or otherwise make fun of her for having birth plan not saying that has happened but do think it the most common thing what do see is people who remind mothers that they should be too invested in their birth plan and to be prepared for things to change so that they are disappointed it might be annoying but it the truth also am frustrated that the author had to make point of privileged educated and more often than not white women being the only ones who have their wishes respected or whatever that not true no matter how rich or well educated or white you are you do have some special option to not have section if your baby needs it and it honestly seems like the way she phrased that whole point was as judgmental and rude as the people she condemning find that most people who say to just to just get one so you do have to be in pain are ignoring or are unaware of all the things other than pain level that having an epidural can affect during birth did want to
